page.title: 06TRANSPORT/RAIL
page.content: Larbert station was built in 1865, and renewed in 1975. It is on the main lines from Glasgow to Perth, Dundee and Aberdeen and from Edinburgh to Stirling and Perth. It is a very busy station-from the timetable we counted 20 trains to Glasgow, 32 trains to Edinburgh and 64 trains to Stirling and the North (and the same going in the other direction) per day. This station transports a lot of{goods}but is predominantly a{passenger}service. The goods trains mainly carry coal, petrol and steel. The first edition Ordnance map shows two stations in Larbert. One was a cattle station and served the local tryst or cattle market. It helped in the decline of the tryst, as{rail transport}became cheaper than the drover method"on the hoof".
